hints.content:
On a clock there are two hands. The $\redD{\text{hour hand}}$ is the shorter hand.  The $\blueE{\text{minute hand}}$ is the longer hand.

![A clock shows the short hour hand points to 5. The long minute hand points to 12.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/45a764740b107b33cf6707c08fe70c7abdbda8c9)

So, $\redD{8}{:}{00} $ looks like this:

![A clock shows the short hour hand points to 8. The long minute hand points to 12. Labels outside the edge of the clock are number 1 through 12.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/f87cde384d3ce378a889e21437bbafe2440e8fd7)

$\redD{8}{:}{\blueE{15}}$ is $\blueE{15}$ ticks from $\redD{8}{:}{00}.$

![A clock shows the short hour hand is just past 8. The long minute hand points to 3. Outside the edge of the clock 12 is labeled 0, 1 is labeled 5, 2 is labeled 10, and so on with 11 labeled 55.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/e1127614faca3f10dcc184cc61d0d1e510637e99)

Notice the hour hand is past $8{:}00$ but not quite to $9{:}00$.

This clock shows $8{:}{15}$.

![A clock shows the short hour hand is just past 8. The long minute hand points to 3.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/20b865d10385b1d09ed3c1a82dea16253cab1251)

![A clock shows the short hour hand is just past 8. The long minute hand points to 4. ](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/c6edaba39c50e26531207fc25f76dd4ddb82358a)
![A clock shows the short hour hand is just past 8. The long minute hand points to 5. ](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/13722e9a128317f9dac20171806a4dc0f7a733ab)
